confirmation_safeBccThresholdCheckboxLab: [Warn] To/Cc fields contain no less than ${threshold} domains
confirmation_safeBccThresholdForAttendee: [Warn] Attendee fields contain no less than ${threshold} domains
confirmation_unsafeDomainRecipientCheckb: [Warn] An unsafe domain "${domain}" found in the recipient list
confirmation_unsafeRecipientCheckboxLabe: [Warn] An unsafe address "${address}" found in the recipient list
confirmation_unsafeAttachmentCheckboxLab: [Warn] An unsafe keyword (${name}) found in the attachment list
block_messageBeforeForMailRecipients: This mail cannot be sent because its recipients contain forbidden recipients.
block_messageBeforeForAppointmentRecipie: This event cannot be sent because its recipients contain forbidden recipients.
block_messageBeforeForMailAttachments: The mail cannot be sent because its attachments contain forbidden files.
block_messageBeforeForAppointmentAttachm: The appointment cannot be sent because its attachments contain forbidden files.
block_messageBeforeForMailBodies: The mail cannot be sent because its body contains forbidden words.
block_messageBeforeForAppointmentBodies: The appointment cannot be sent because its body contains forbidden words.
newlyAddedDomainReconfirmation_messageBe: There are recipients with domains not included in the recipients of the original message.
There are attendees with domains not included in the attendees of the original appointment.
Reconfirmation_safeBccReconfirmationThre: [Warn] To/Cc fields contain no less than ${threshold} domains.
[Warn] Attendee fields contain no less than ${threshold} domains.
Reconfirmation_unsafeDomains: The following unsafe domains found in the recipient list.
Reconfirmation_unsafeAddresses: The following unsafe addresses found in the recipient list.
Reconfirmation_unsafeFiles: The following unsafe files found in the attachment list.
Reconfirmation_confirmToSend: Do you really want to send this message?
convertToBcc_description: ${threshold} or more To/CC fields are specified.
convertToBcc_confirmation: Do you want to convert To/CC to BCC?
setting_trustedDomainsPolicy:
# Trusted Domains and Addresses ###
# The following domains and addresses are trusted by Group Policy.
#
# ${policy}
#
# To add more domains or addresses, input entries (one per line) below.
# You can also exclude domains or addresses by adding "-" at the beginning.
# And wildcards (* and ?) are also available.
# When an entry contains @, the entry is regarded as address.
# When an entry does not contains @, the entry is regarded as domain.
##################################

${user}
setting_trustedDomainsTemplate:
# Trusted Domains and Addresses ###
#
# (1) Set the list of domains and addresses to be treated as internal ones.
# (2) Enter one entry per line as follows.
# (3) Lines starting with # are ignored.
# (4) Wildcards (* and ?) are available.
# (5) When an entry contains @, the entry is regarded as address.
# (6) When an entry does not contains @, the entry is regarded as domain.
#
##################################

example.com
example.org
setting_unsafeDomainsPolicy:
# Unsafe Domains and Addresses ###
# The following domains and addresses are considered unsafe by Group Policy.
#
# ${policy}
#
# To add more domains or addresses, input entries (one per line) below.
# You can also exclude domains or addresses by adding "-" at the beginning.
# And wildcards (* and ?) are also available.
# When an entry contains @, the entry is regarded as address.
# When an entry does not contains @, the entry is regarded as domain.
# The following sections can be specified:
#   * [WARNING]: Show warning
#   * [REWARNING]: Show the re-warning dialog
#   * [BLOCK]: Prohibit sending
# If the section is omitted, it is regarded as [WARNING].
##################################

${user}
setting_unsafeDomainsTemplate:
# Unsafe Domains and Addresses ###
#
# (1) Set the list of domains and addresses to show an "unsafe recipient" warning.
# (2) Enter one entry per line as follows.
# (3) Lines starting with # are ignored.
# (4) Wildcards (* and ?) are available.
# (5) When an entry contains @, the entry is regarded as address.
# (6) When an entry does not contains @, the entry is regarded as domain.
# (7) The following sections can be specified:
#        * [WARNING]: Show warning
#        * [REWARNING]: Show the re-warning dialog
#        * [BLOCK]: Prohibit sending
#      If the section is omitted, it is regarded as [WARNING].
#
##################################

example.jp
example.net
setting_unsafeFilesPolicy:
# Unsafe Files ###
# The following keywords are considered unsafe by Group Policy.
#
# ${policy}
#
# To add more keywords, input entries (one per line) below.
# You can also exclude keywords by adding "-" at the beginning.
# And wildcards (* and ?) are also available.
# The following sections can be specified:
#   * [WARNING]: Show warning
#   * [REWARNING]: Show the re-warning dialog
#   * [BLOCK]: Prohibit sending
# If the section is omitted, it is regarded as [WARNING].
##################################

${user}
setting_unsafeFilesTemplate:
# Unsafe Files ###
#
# (1) Set the list of keywords to show an "unsafe filename" warning.
# (2) Enter one entry per line as follows.
# (3) Lines starting with # are ignored.
# (4) Wildcards (* and ?) are available.
# (5) The following sections can be specified:
#        * [WARNING]: Show warning
#        * [REWARNING]: Show the re-warning dialog
#        * [BLOCK]: Prohibit sending
#      If the section is omitted, it is regarded as [WARNING].
#
##################################

secret
confidential
setting_unsafeBodiesPolicy:
# Unsafe Bodies ###
# The following keywords (sections) are considerd unsafe by Group Policy.
#
# ${policy}
#
# To add more keywords, input sections below.
# You can specify any section name.
# The following parameters must be specified in each section:
#     * Keywords: Specify keywords separated by commas (,).
#         * You can also exclude keywords by adding "-" at the beginning.
#         * Wildcards (* and ?) are also available.
#     * Message: Specify a warning message to be displayed when a keyword is matched.
#     * Language: Specify the target language (ja-JP, en, etc.). If omitted, all languages is targeted.
# Lines starting with # are ignored.
##################################

${user}
setting_unsafeBodiesTemplate:
# Unsafe Bodies ###
#
# (1) Set the list of keywords (sections) to show an "unsafe bodies" warning.
# (2) Enter sections as follows.
# (3) You can specify any section name.
# (4) The following parameters must be specified in each section:
#     * Keywords: Specify keywords separated by commas (,).
#         * You can also exclude keywords by adding "-" at the beginning.
#         * Wildcards (* and ?) are also available.
#     * Message: Specify a warning message to be displayed when a keyword is matched.
#     * Language: Specify the target language (ja-JP, en, etc.). If omitted, all languages is targeted.
# (5) Lines starting with # are ignored.
##################################

[Example]
Keywords=Confidential,confidential,Confidential
Message=[Warn] Including "Confidential" in body.
setting_configCountAllowSkip: Show "Send Now" button in the countdown dialog
setting_configCountEnabled: Show a countdown clock when sending a message
setting_configMainSkipIfNoExt: Skip confirmation if all the recpients are trusted.
setting_configAppointmentConfirmationEna: Enable confirmation on sending an appointment from Calendar.
setting_configSafeBccEnabled: Enable "too many domains in To/Cc fields" warnings
setting_configConvertToBccEnabled: Enable to convert To/CC to Bcc when too many To/CC fields
setting_configConvertToBccThreshold: Convert if To/CC fields are greater than or equal to
setting_configSafeNewDomainsEnabled: Confirm when any recipients with domains different from any existing recipients are added
setting_delayDeliverySeconds: Delay delivery a message by (in seconds)
setting_requireCheckBody: Require to check the message body
